2009GeoRL..3619503V | citeseerx = 10.1.1.170.8753 }}</ref><ref>{{Cite journal | last1 = Cazenave | first1 = A. | last2 = Dominh | first2 = K. | last3 = Guinehut | first3 = S. | last4 = Berthier | first4 = E. | last5 = Llovel | first5 = W. | last6 = Ramillien | first6 = G. | last7 = Ablain | first7 = M. | last8 = Larnicol | first8 = G. | doi = 10.1016/j.gloplacha.2008.10.004 | title = Sea level budget over 2003–2008: A reevaluation from GRACE space gravimetry, satellite altimetry and Argo | journal = Global and Planetary Change | volume = 65 | issue = 1 | pages = 83–88 | year = 2009 | pmid = | pmc = |bibcode = 2009GPC....65...83C | url = https://hal.archives-ouvertes.fr/hal-00401223/document }}</ref> The fact that the IPCC estimates did not include rapid ice sheet decay into their sea level predictions makes it difficult to ascertain a plausible estimate for sea level rise but recent studies find that the minimum sea level rise will be around {{convert|0.8|m|ft}} by 2100.<ref name="pmid18772435">{{cite journal |author=Pfeffer WT, Harper JT, O'Neel S |title=Kinematic constraints on glacier contributions to 21st-century sea-level rise |journal=[[Science (journal)|Science]] |volume=321 |issue=5894 |pages=1340–3 |date=September 2008 |pmid=18772435 |doi=10.1126/science.1159099 |url= |bibcode = 2008Sci...321.1340P |last2=Harper |last3=O'Neel }}</ref>

https://web.archive.org/web/20130515081904/http://www.sundogpublishing.com/shop/recession-of-equatorial-glaciers-a-photo-documenation-s-hastenrath/ |archivedate = 2013-05-15 |df = }} * {{cite book | |editor5=Kääb, A. | publisher = [[World Glacier Monitoring Service]] | location = Paris }} * {{cite web | author = National Park Service, U.S. Department of the Interior | title = Icefields and Glaciers | work = Tongass National Forest, Forest Facts | url = http://www.fs.fed.us/r10/tongass/forest_facts/resources/geology/icefields.htm | publisher = [[United States Forest Service]] | accessdate = July 10, 2002 }} * {{cite web |author = [[NOAA]] |title = Arctic Change |work = [[Study of Environmental Arctic Change]] |url = http://www.arctic.noaa.gov/detect/ice-glacier.shtml |accessdate = February 15, 2006 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20060206073524/http://www.arctic.noaa.gov/detect/ice-glacier.shtml |archivedate = February 6, 2006 |df = }} * revision.text:
{{unreferenced|date=February 2016}} {{infobox road |country=IDN |type=Toll |name= Serpong–Balaraja Toll Road |maint=Transbsd Balaraja |length_km= 31 | Direction = | terminus_a= [[Jakarta–Serpong Toll Road]] | cities= [[South Tangerang]], [[Tangerang Regency]] | terminus_b= Balaraja IC | formed= (under construction) | history= | junction= {{AHN-AH|2}} [[Jakarta–Serpong Toll Road]]
[[Tangerang–Merak Toll Road]] | system = }} The Serpong-Balaraja is a [[toll road]] extended from the [[Jakarta–Serpong Toll Road]]. It crosses one city and a regency. The project costs RP 3.7 billion and its expected completion is 2018. This will provide access from Serpong to [[Port of Merak|Merak]]. ==Building stages== *Stage 1: Serpong–Legok (11 km) *Stage 2: Legok–Citra Raya (8 km) *Stage 3: Citra Raya–Balaraja (12 km) ==Planned toll gate== * BSD City 1 (AEON Mall) * BSD City 2 (Kws. Industri) * BSD City 3 (Residential) * Legok * Citraraya * Balaraja [[Category:Geography of Indonesia]] [[Category:Toll roads in Indonesia]]

{{Other places|Sugar Loaf (disambiguation){{!}}Sugarloaf (disambiguation)}} :''Mountains with a similar name are listed at [[Sugarloaf_(mountain)]]''
'''Sugar Loaf''' is a forested mountain in the [[Western Area]] of [[Sierra Leone]] in west [[Africa]]. The capital city of [[Freetown]] is built around its lower slopes. Parts of the mountain are protected as the [[Western Area Forest Reserve]].<ref>https://www.visitsierraleone.org/sugar-loaf-mountain/</ref>
The 19th-century British missionary [[George Thompson (traveller)|George Thompson]] documented his ascent of Sugar Loaf in his 1859 book ''The Palm Land; Or, West Africa, Illustrated''.<ref name="Thompson1859">{{cite book|author=George Thompson|title=The Palm Land; Or, West Africa, Illustrated. Being a History of Missionary Labors and Travels, with Descriptions of Men and Things in Western Africa. Also, a Synopsis of All the Missionary Work on that Continent|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=QP9EAAAAIAAJ|year=1859|publisher=Moore, Wilstach, Keys & Company, printers}}</ref>
On Monday 14 August, 2017 in the [[2017 Sierra Leone mudslides]] a landslide triggered by heavy rains swept down one of its flanks and inundated a part of the urban area of [[Regent, Sierra Leone|Regent]] with mud with many deaths reported.<ref>https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/live/world-africa-40825933</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2014}} {{Use Australian English|date=July 2014}} {{About|the rock formation in [[New South Wales]] ([[Australia]])|the islands in [[Queensland]] ([[Australia]])|The Three Sisters (Queensland)|other uses|Three Sisters (disambiguation)}} [[File:blue mountains - three sisters.jpg|thumb|270px|The Three Sisters towering above the [[Jamison Valley]]. The lighter coloured orange/yellow sections indicate fresh rock, exposed by recent erosion.]]
The '''Three Sisters''' are an unusual [[rock formation]] in the [[Blue Mountains (Australia)|Blue Mountains]] of [[New South Wales]], [[Australia]], on the north escarpment of the [[Jamison Valley]]. They are close to the town of [[Katoomba, New South Wales|Katoomba]] and are one of the Blue Mountains' best known sites, towering above the Jamison Valley.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.visitnsw.com/destinations/blue-mountains/katoomba-area/katoomba/attractions/three-sisters-in-the-blue-mountains-national-park|title=Three Sisters in the Blue Mountains - Katoomba|publisher=VisitNSW.com|accessdate=18 November 2012}}</ref> Their names are Meehni (922 m), Wimlah (918 m), and Gunnedoo (906 m).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bluemts.com.au/tourist/thingstodo/threesisters/|title=The Three Sisters|publisher=Stralia Web|accessdate=18 November 2012}}</ref>
[[File:Three Sisters Sunset.jpg|thumb|right|180px|The Three Sisters at sunset]]
==Geology== The Sisters were formed by land [[erosion]]. The [[Banks Wall Sandstone|sandstone]] of the Blue Mountains was eroded over time by wind, rain and rivers, causing the cliffs surrounding the Jamison Valley to be slowly broken up. [[File:The Rock Peak Meehni of the Three Sisters.jpeg|thumb|right|270px|Tourists get close touch to the Rock Peak Meehni of the Three Sisters]] [[File:3SistersandMtSolitary.jpg|thumb|A view of The Three Sisters rock formation alongside Mount Solitary.]]
==Aboriginal legend== The commonly told legend of the Three Sisters is that three sisters, Meehni, Wimlah and Gunnedoo, lived in the Jamison Valley as members of the Katoomba tribe. They fell in love with three men from the neighbouring Nepean tribe, but [[marriage]] was forbidden by tribal law. The brothers were not happy to accept this [[law]] and so decided to use force to capture the three sisters. A major tribal battle ensued, and the sisters were turned to stone by an elder to protect them, but he was killed in the fighting and no one else could turn them back. This legend is claimed to be an [[Indigenous Australians|Indigenous Australian]] [[Dreamtime (mythology)|Dreamtime]] legend.<ref>{{cite news |last=Sarzin|first=Anne |title=Myth and meaning in the Blue Mountains |work=UTS: Newsroom > U:Read it |publisher=University of Technology |date=2003-11-03 |url=http://newsroom.uts.edu.au/news/2003/11/myth-and-meaning-in-the-blue-mountains |accessdate=2014-07-18}}</ref>
The Aboriginal traditional owners, the [[Gandangara people|Gundungurra]], have a legend that includes the Sisters rock formation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gundungurra.org.au/|title=Gundungurra Tribal Council Aboriginal Corporation|publisher=Baddog Productions|accessdate=18 November 2012}}</ref>
==Giant Stairway== From nearby [[Echo Point (lookout)|Echo Point]], a bushwalking trail leads to the Three Sisters and down to the [[valley]] floor via more than 800 well-maintained [[steel]] and stone steps called "the Giant Stairway". Then a 1.5-hour walk on The Federal Pass trail leads to the base of Katoomba Falls and the [[Katoomba Scenic Railway]]. Walkers who don't wish to climb back to the top can take the Scenic Railway back to the plateau for a fee.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External Links== {{Commons category|Three Sisters, Blue Mountains|Three Sisters}} * [http://0pointer.de/static/three-sisters.html Panoramic view of the Three Sisters] * [http://99boomerangs.com/2012/12/05/the-giant-stairway-of-the-blue-mountains/ Article about the making of 'The Giant Stairway']

States of Colombia]] (now Colombia). As President of this legislative body, Zaldúa became the ''de facto'' [[President of the United States of Colombia]] for 6 days, when President [[Tomás Cipriano de Mosquera]] ceded executive power to the Convention, and until the said convention elected a [[Council of Ministers of the Republic of Colombia|Council of Ministers]] to serve collectively as the Colombian [[head of state]]. |- | 22 December || [[José Eusebio Otalora]] is [[President of the United States of Colombia]], in his capacity as the [[Second Presidential Designate]] following the death of President [[Francisco Javier Zaldúa]], and the non acceptance of the office by the First Designate [[Rafael Núñez (politician)|Rafael Núñez]]. |- | rowspan="3" style="vertical-align:top;"| 1884 || 1 April || [[Ezequiel Hurtado]] is [[President of the United States of Colombia]] |- | 11 August || [[Rafael Núñez (politician)|Rafael Nuñez]] is [[President of Colombia|President]] of the [[United States of Colombia]] for second time |- | 28 August || [[ETB (company)]] is created, being the first telecommunications company in Colombia |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:top;"| 1886 || || President [[Rafael Núñez (politician)|Rafael Nuñez]] creates the [[Colombian Constitution of 1886]], which has been one of the longest lasting constitutions in the western hemisphere, and with the Reforms of 1910, 1936, 1958, 1968, 1973 and 1986 was the constitution of Colombia until 1991. About 17 people died. Several body parts remained unidentified. The package exploded as he walked through the banking sector of [[Cali]], killing him and wounding four others. The package reportedly contained 500 grams of [[ammonium nitrate]] fuel oil.{{cite news |first= |last= |coauthors= |title= |url=http://www.terrorisminfo.mipt.org/incidentcalendar.asp |date=14 November 2000 |accessdate=16 November 2008 |publisher=Reuters |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080709002239/http://www.terrorisminfo.mipt.org/incidentcalendar.asp |archivedate=9 July 2008 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} |- | 4 December || Politician [[Fernando Araújo Perdomo]] is kidnapped by the Farc guerrilla |- | 18 December || Opening of the mass transportation system [[Transmilenio]] in Bogotá |} {{anchor|3rd millennium}} == 21st century == {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- ! style="width:6%" | Year || style="width:10%" | Date || Event |- | rowspan="9" style="vertical-align:top;"| 2001 || || The [[stock market]]s of Cali, Medellín and Bogotá are fused into a single entity: [[Bolsa de Valores de Colombia]] |- | || Singer [[Shakira Mebarak]] wins a [[Grammy Award]] for her MTV unplugged |- | 24 April || the [[United States House Committee on Foreign Affairs|House of Representatives Committee on International Relations]] published the findings of its investigation into [[Irish Republican Army|IRA]] activities in Colombia |- | 4 May || A car bomb kills four and injures 32 in a luxury hotel in [[Cali]]. [[Jhon Frank Pinchao]] escapes from the FARC guerrilla spending near a month lost in the jungle |- | May || [[Virginia Vallejo]], media personality and former lover of [[Pablo Escobar]], published her memoir ''Amando a Pablo, odiando a Escobar'' (Loving Pablo, Hating Escobar), where she accused several Colombian presidents of involvement with drug traffickers |- | 28 June || Murder of the politicians kidnapped in the [[Valle del Cauca Deputies hostage crisis]] causes national outrage |- | 7 September || [[Colombian coffee]] achieves [[Protected designation of origin]] status granted by the [[European Union]] {{cite web|url=http://actualidad.terra.es/nacional/articulo/union_europea_cafe_colombia_indicacion_1778987.htm |title=European Union gives to 'Café de Colombia' the protected denomination of origin |publisher=Terra |date=13 August 2007 |accessdate=22 April 2008 |language=es |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080508225406/http://actualidad.terra.es/nacional/articulo/union_europea_cafe_colombia_indicacion_1778987.htm |archivedate=8 May 2008 |df= }} |- | 13 December || [[International Court of Justice]] of [[The Hague]] concluded the long-time dispute with the [[Republic of Nicaragua]] over the [[Archipelago of San Andrés, Providencia and Santa Catalina|San Andrés y Providencia Islands]] in favor of Colombian sovereignty over the San Andres Archipelago, ratifying the Esguerra-Bárcenas treaty.[http://www.elespectador.com/elespectador/Secciones/Detalles.aspx?idNoticia=19116&idSeccion=21 {{es icon}} El Espectador: La Haya decide su jurisdicción en lío de isla de San Andrés] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080215215312/http://www.elespectador.com/elespectador/Secciones/Detalles.aspx?idNoticia=19116&idSeccion=21 |date=15 February 2008 }} signed between 1928 and 1930 {{cite web |url=http://www.icj-cij.org/docket/files/124/14303.pdf |title=International Court of Justice: Colombia-Nicaragua case resolution |format=PDF |date= |accessdate=26 July 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121207030422/http://www.icj-cij.org/docket/files/124/14303.pdf |archivedate=7 December 2012 |df=dmy-all }} |- | rowspan="11" style="vertical-align:top;"| 2008 || 10 January || Former vice presidential candidate [[Clara Rojas]] and former congresswoman [[Consuelo González]] are freed after nearly six years in captivity |- | 1 March || The Colombian military attacks a FARC camp inside [[Ecuador]]'s territory. Several guerrilla casualties including guerrilla leader [[Raul Reyes]] starting the [[2008 Andean diplomatic crisis]] |- | 3 March || [[Iván Ríos]], a member of the FARC [[FARC-EP Chain of Command#Secretariat|Central High Command]] was killed by his security chief "Rojas". |- | 26 March || Guerrilla commander [[Manuel Marulanda Vélez]] dies |- | 18 May || Guerrilla leader [[Elda Neyis Mosquera]] alias "Karina" surrenders herself to the military forces |- | 2 July || Under a Colombian military operation called [[Operation Jaque]], the FARC was tricked by the Colombian Government into releasing 15 hostages to Colombian Intelligence agents, including [[Ingrid Betancourt]], U.S military contractors, and Colombian soldiers and police officers |- | 15 August || [[Ituango]], [[Antioquia Department|Antioquia]]. Seven people were killed and more than 50 wounded when a bomb detonated in a small town |- | 21 August || Colombia has chosen the European [[DVB-T]] standard for [[Digital terrestrial television]] |- | 30 October || Accusations of [[Colombian army]] soldiers involved with criminal bands with the purpose of luring unsuspecting unemployed or homeless people into isolated areas where they were murdered and the scenes were staged as combats against [[guerrilla]] in order to enhance their achievements and get [[performance-related pay]]ments, were investigated. The events, known as the [['false positives' scandal]], led to the resignation of [[Commander-in-chief]], general [[Mario Montoya Uribe|Mario Montoya]].{{cite web|url=http://alainet.org/active/27176 |title=El escándalo de los falsos positivos |publisher=Alainet.org |date=30 October 2008 |accessdate=26 July 2012}} As of 2012, 3,350 such cases had been investigated in all parts of the country and verdicts had been reached in 170 cases.{{cite news|title=In Colombia, 6 sentenced in 'false positives' death scheme|author=|date=14 June 2012|newspaper=Los Angeles Times|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2012/jun/14/world/la-fg-colombia-false-positives-20120614|first=Chris|last=Kraul}} |- | 12 November ||Riots broke out in the municipalities of [[Pasto]], [[Tumaco]], [[Popayán]] and later spread all over the country after the collapse of several [[pyramid scheme]]s. Thousands of victims had invested their money in pyramids that promised them extraordinary interest rates. The lack of regulation laws allowed those pyramids to grow excessively during several years. Finally, after the riots the Colombian government was forced to declare the country in economical emergency in order to seize and stop those schemes. Several of the pyramid's managers were arrested and are being prosecuted for the crime of "illegal massive money reception".{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/7726069.stm | work=BBC News | title=Colombians riot over pyramid scam | date=13 November 2008 | accessdate=25 May 2010}} |- | 22 November || Colombia and Canada signed a new [[Canadian dollar|$]]1.14 billion dollar [[bilateral trade|bilateral]] [[trade agreement]] (the [[Canada-Colombia relations|Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement]]) at the [[Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation]] meeting. |- | rowspan="18" style="vertical-align:top;"| 2009 || rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:top;"| 8 January || Colombian drug lord and head of the [[Caquetá Department|Caqueta]] cartel [[Leonidas Vargas]] is murdered inside a hospital. his brother(Héctor Fabio Vargas) and his girlfriend (Colombian actress [[Liliana Lozano|Liliana Andrea Lozano]]) were tortured and murdered {{cite web|url=http://www.elpais.com.co/paisonline/notas/Enero142009/lilianaloz.html |accessdate=16 September 2009 }}{{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} in [[Pradera]], Colombia.{{cite news| url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/europe/article5517866.ece | work=The Times | location=London | title=Brother and girlfriend of slain drugs baron Vargas are shot dead | first=Graham | last=Keeley | date=14 January 2009 | accessdate=25 May 2010}} |- | [[Recognition of same-sex unions in Colombia]] is achieved by rule of the Constitutional Court |- | 11 January || Reports of mass murders of [[Awá (kwaiker)]] indigenous people by FARC guerrilla |- | February || Colombia has extended its existing tobacco control regulations by a [[smoking ban]] requiring all indoor work places and public places be immediately smoke-free, prohibiting tobacco advertising, promotions and sponsorship |- | February || the [[fossil]]s of 28 individual ''[[Titanoboa cerrejonensis]]'', the largest snake ever discovered, were announced to have been found in the [[Coal mining|coal mines]] of [[Cerrejón]] in [[Department of La Guajira|La Guajira]], Colombia.{{cite news | title = Fossil of 43-foot super snake Titanoboa found in Colombia | url = http://www.latimes.com/news/nationworld/world/la-sci-snake5-2009feb05,0,6550292.story | publisher = [[Los Angeles Times]] | first = Thomas H. | last = Maugh II | date = 4 February 2009 | accessdate =4 February 2009 }} |- | March ||The '''[[Alvarez case]]''' was uncovered when 59-year-old Arcedio Alvarez was arrested in [[Mariquita, Tolima|Mariquita]], Colombia, accused of sexually abusing his now 30-year-old daughter Alba Nidia Alvarez since the age of 9.{{cite web|url=http://news.sky.com/skynews/Home/World-News/Colombian-Fritzl-Arcebio-Alvarez-Accused-Over-Eight-Kids-With-Daughter-Alba-Nidia-Mariquita/Article/200903415251269 |title='Colombian Fritzl' – Eight Kids With Daughter |publisher=News.sky.com |date=30 March 2009 |accessdate=26 July 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110620075058/http://news.sky.com/skynews/Home/World-News/Colombian-Fritzl-Arcebio-Alvarez-Accused-Over-Eight-Kids-With-Daughter-Alba-Nidia-Mariquita/Article/200903415251269 |archivedate=20 June 2011 |df= }} The daughter also gave birth to 11 children, three of whom died.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/7970414.stm |title=Colombia shocked by incest case |publisher=BBC News |date=30 March 2009 |accessdate=26 July 2012}} |- | March ||the Colombian government enacted a mandate to introduce [[Common ethanol fuel mixtures#E85|E85]] [[flexible-fuel vehicle]]s |- | 15 March || [[Luis Carlos Sarmiento Angulo]] gets ranked in the ''[[Forbes]]'' list of world billionaires.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/lists/2009/10/billionaires-2009-richest-people_The-Worlds-Billionaires_Rank_12.html|title=The World's Billionaires|publisher=Forbes.com|accessdate=15 March 2009|date=11 March 2009}} |- | April || The Colombian armed forces launched ''Strategic Leap'',{{cite web|url=http://www.colombiareports.com/colombia-news/news/3445-operation-strategic-leap-to-marginalize-farc-vp.html |title=Operation 'Strategic Leap' to marginalize FARC: VP – Colombia news |publisher=Colombia Reports |date=1 April 2009 |accessdate=26 July 2012}} an offensive in borders areas where the FARC's forces has still a strong military presence, especially in [[Arauca Department|Arauca]], near the Venezuelan border.{{cite web|url=http://www.colombiareports.com/colombia-news/news/3551-colombia-attacks-rebels-in-border-areas.html |title=Colombia attacks rebels in border areas – Colombia news |publisher=Colombia Reports |date=10 April 2009 |accessdate=26 July 2012}} |- | April ||Colombian drug lord [[Daniel Rendón Herrera]] alias Don "Mario" is captured while hiding in a jungle.[https://archive.is/20090419162450/http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090415/ap_on_re_la_am_ca/lt_colombia_drug_lord;_ylt=AnfFedRZ0D4SWR9.7Gj9qMVvaA8F Yahoo! Search – Web Search] |- | 13 May || [[Vallenato]] composer and [[troubadour]] [[Rafael Escalona]] dies due to heart failure.{{Cite news|publication-date=13 May 2009 |title=Colombia llora la muerte de Rafael Escalona, quien falleció el miércoles en Bogotá a los 81 años |periodical=[[El Tiempo (Colombia)|El Tiempo]] |url=http://www.eltiempo.com/culturayocio/musica_in/fallecio-el-maestro-rafael-escalona_5181750-1 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120629112146/http://www.eltiempo.com/culturayocio/musica_in/fallecio-el-maestro-rafael-escalona_5181750-1 |archive-date=29 June 2012 |accessdate=14 May 2009 |postscript= |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} |- | 14 May ||During his visit to Colombia, the [[Czech Republic]] Prime Minister [[Mirek Topolánek]] negotiated a possible sale of [[Aero L-159 Alca]] [[combat aircraft]] with Colombian President [[Álvaro Uribe]].{{cite web|title=PM Topolánek visits Colombia |url=http://www.radio.cz/en/news/104078 |work= |publisher=Radio Prague – News |date= |accessdate=14 May 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081001193147/http://www.radio.cz/en/news/104078 |archivedate=1 October 2008 |df=dmy }}{{cite web | title=Topolánek chce Kolumbii prodat česká bitevní letadla | url=http://www.novinky.cz/ekonomika/140057-topolanek-chce-kolumbii-prodat-ceska-bitevni-letadla.html | work= | publisher=Novinky.cz | date= | accessdate=14 May 2009|language=cs}} |- | June || [[Clara Guerrero]] wins Women's World Championship [[World Ranking Masters]] |- | July 2009 || The Colombian government claimed that [[AT4]] anti-tank rockets manufactured by [[Saab Bofors Dynamics]] of Sweden, which were later purchased by Venezuela were being used by the FARC. In response, President Chavez ordered most staff members of the embassy in Colombia to return to Venezuela, including the ambassador. Only the "lowest functionaries" were left to staff the embassy.{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/americas/07/28/venezuela.colombia/index.html|title=Venezuela freezes relations with Colombia|last=Brice|first=Authur|accessdate=29 July 2009 | work=CNN | date=29 July 2009}} |- | 18 July || [[Ricardo Londoño]], Colombia's first [[Formula One]] driver is murdered in the north Colombian [[Córdoba Department]]. |- | 8 August || Cuban artist [[Tania Bruguera]] sets a controversial performance in the [[National University of Colombia]] (Bogotá branch), included consumption of cocaine{{cite web| url=http://centrefortheaestheticrevolution.blogspot.com/2009/08/tania-brugueras-performance-in-colombia.html| title=Centre for the Aesthetic Revolution:tania-brugueras-controversial-performance-in-colombia}} provided by the artist to the attendants.{{cite web| url=http://www.eltiempo.com/culturayocio/arte_eltiempo_vivein/tania-bruguera-que-sirvio-cocaina-en-un-performance-suele-hacer-montajes-polemicos_6086567-1| title=El Tiempo, Tania Bruguera, que sirvió cocaína en un performance, suele hacer montajes polémicos| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130123122904/http://www.eltiempo.com/culturayocio/arte_eltiempo_vivein/tania-bruguera-que-sirvio-cocaina-en-un-performance-suele-hacer-montajes-polemicos_6086567-1| archivedate=23 January 2013| df=dmy-all}}{{cite web| url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l4axx4u_mW8| title=VIDEO YouTube by Jepenuela, Colombian Art Critic of the Event}} |- | 30 August || President [[Álvaro Uribe]] had contracted the [[AH1N1]] flu virus, becoming the second [[head of state]] to do so (the first being [[Óscar Arias]]).{{cite web |url=http://www.eltiempo.com/vidadehoy/salud/nuevagripa/presidente-lvaro-uribe-contrajo-el-virus-de-la-nueva-influenza_5976590-1 |title=Tras ser diagnosticado con la nueva gripa, Uribe gobernará 'virtualmente', al menos hasta el martes – Nueva Gripa – Salud – Vida de Hoy – |publisher=Eltiempo.com |date= |accessdate=26 July 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120728225139/http://www.eltiempo.com/vidadehoy/salud/nuevagripa/presidente-lvaro-uribe-contrajo-el-virus-de-la-nueva-influenza_5976590-1 |archivedate=28 July 2012 |df=dmy-all }} |- | 11 September || A group of eradicators of [[Coca production in Colombia|Coca crops]] near the village of La Gabarra, [[Tibú|Municipality of Tibú]], [[Norte de Santander Department|Norte de Santander]] is attacked by guerrilla forces with a donkey with bombs attached to it. 2 people deceased{{cite web|url=http://es.noticias.yahoo.com/5/20090912/twl-la-explosin-de-un-burro-bomba-mata-a-f6923c3.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2009-09-16 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090916101850/http://es.noticias.yahoo.com/5/20090912/twl-la-explosin-de-un-burro-bomba-mata-a-f6923c3.html |archivedate=16 September 2009 |df= }} |} ==See {{use mdy dates|date=November 2014}} {{MedalTableTop |image=William Libbey.jpg |imagesize=250px |caption=William A. Libbey III |nation=USA|sport=Men's [[Shooting at the Summer Olympics|Shooting]]|medals= {{Medal|Olympic}} {{Medal|Silver| [[1912 Summer Olympics|1912 Stockholm]] | [[Shooting at the 1912 Summer Olympics - Men's 100 metre team running deer, single shots|team running deer,
single shots]]}} }} '''William A. Libbey III''' (March 27, 1855 – September 6, 1927) was an [[United States|American]] professor of [[physical geography]] at [[Princeton University]]. He was twice a member of the U.S. Olympic Rifle Team, and rose to the rank of [[colonel]] in the [[New Jersey National Guard]]. He is also known for his first ascent of [[Mount Princeton]] in 1877. ==Biography== [[File:Lewis School Princeton south facade.jpg|thumb|left|Libbey's Princeton home, Thanet Lodge, also known as Greenholm, built in 1902, now home to the [[Lewis School of Princeton]]]] ===Early life=== He was born in [[Jersey City, New Jersey]] to William Libbey, Jr., a wealthy New York City merchant, and Elizabeth Marsh (Libbey).[http://etcweb.princeton.edu/CampusWWW/Companion/geological_geophysical_sciences_department.html "Geological and Geophysical Sciences, Department of " Princeton University] As an undergraduate at Princeton Libbey was responsible for the adoption of orange and black as the school colors. During his freshman year he wore a tie, on a dare from classmate Melanchthon Jacobus, with the colors of [[William III of England]], [[House of Orange-Nassau|Prince of Orange-Nassau]], after whom [[Nassau Street (Princeton)|Nassau Street]] had been named in 1724, and later [[Nassau Hall]] in 1756.{{cite book|last1=Bearse|first1=Myrna|title=Princeton: Still Making History|date=2005|publisher=Indigo Custom Publishing|isbn=978-0976287575|page=7|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=ia5qlL4YCh0C&pg=PA7 }} The next year he arranged for the manufacture of 1,000 yards of orange and black ribbon and proceeded to sell it, from the [[Grand Union Hotel (Saratoga Springs, New York)|Grand Union Hotel]], at an intercollegiate regatta in [[Saratoga, New York]] as "Princeton's colors." After the Princeton crew team won, he sold out and orange and black have been Princeton's definitive colors ever since.{{cite web|title=Princeton's Colors: The Orange and the Black|url=https://www.princeton.edu/princetoniana/things-princeton/colors-shields/|website=Princetoniana|publisher=Princeton University}} ===Professor=== Libbey graduated from Princeton in 1877 and that summer went on the Princeton scientific expedition to the [[Western United States|West]]. It was there that on the afternoon of July 17, 1877, at 12:30 pm he reached the summit of Mount Princeton.[https://www.princeton.edu/~paw/archive_old/PAW97-98/02-1008/1008feat1.html Merritt, J. I. (1997) "The Once and Future Mountain" ''Princeton Alumni Weekly'' Princeton University] Following his summer in the West, Libbey studied in Berlin and Paris.[https://www.princeton.edu/~paw/archive_old/PAW97-98/02-1008/1008feat1.html#libbey "William Libbey and the 1877 Expedition" ''Princeton Alumni Weekly'' Princeton University] Libbey returned and received his [[doctorate]] in geology in 1879, the first awarded by Princeton. In 1880 he was appointed as director of the Elizabeth Marsh Museum of Geology and Archaeology as well as an associate professor to teach physical geography. In 1883 he was appointed as a full professor and continued to teach the physical geography classes. In 1897 Libbey was involved with the controversy concerning whether the [[Acoma Pueblo|Acoma]] people had once lived on [[Enchanted Mesa]]. After great exertion, he spent a couple of hours on the mesa top and concluded that nothing was there and that it had never been occupied. Subsequent work by archaeologists have shown that Libbey's conclusion was hasty.[http://www.freenewmexican.com/news/43920.html Simmons, Marc (20 May 2006) "Trail dust: The Enchanted Mesa: myth or true tale?" ''The Santa Fe New Mexican''] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080531004304/http://www.freenewmexican.com/news/43920.html |date=May 31, 2008 }} At the [[1912 Summer Olympics]] he won the silver medal as a member of the American team in the team running deer, [[Shooting sports|single shots competition]].[http://www.databaseolympics.com/players/playerpage.htm?ilkid=LIBBEWIL01 "William Libbey" profile Olympics database] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070901171121/http://www.databaseolympics.com/players/playerpage.htm?ilkid=LIBBEWIL01 |date=September 1, 2007 }} Libbey died in [[Princeton, New Jersey]]. ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== {{commons category|William Libbey}} * [https://www.princeton.edu/~paw/archive_old/PAW97-98/02-1008/1008feat1.html#libbey "William Libbey and the 1877 Expedition" ''Princeton Alumni Weekly'' Princeton University] * [http://diglib.princeton.edu/ead/eadGetDoc.xq?id=/ead/mss/C0872.EAD.xml "William Libbey Correspondence, 1876-1925" Princeton University] profile * [http://libweb.princeton.edu/libraries/firestone/rbsc/aids/libbey.html "William Libbey Correspondence" Princeton University] listed correspondents * {{Librivox author |id=11438}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Libbey, William}} [[Category:1855 births]] [[Category:1927 deaths]] [[Category:Sportspeople from Jersey City, New Jersey]] [[Category:American mountain climbers]] [[Category:American male sport shooters]] [[Category:Running target shooters]] [[Category:American geographers]] [[Category:American geologists]] [[Category:American archaeologists]] [[Category:Olympic shooters of the United States]] [[Category:Olympic silver medalists for the United States in shooting]] [[Category:Shooters at the 1912 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Medalists at the 1912 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Princeton University faculty]] [[Category:Princeton University alumni]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox website | name = Yandex Maps | creator = [[Yandex]] | programming language = [[C++]] (back-end), [[JavaScript]], [[XML]], [[Ajax (programming)|Ajax]] (UI) | logo = Yandex.Maps logo.jpg | screenshot = | caption = | collapsible = | collapsetext = | url = {{URL|https://yandex.com/maps/}} | commercial = Yes | type = [[Web mapping]] | key_people = | language = Multilingual | registration = Optional, included with a Yandex account | owner = [[Yandex]] | launched = {{start date and age|2004|8|27|df=yes}} | current status = Active, developing | revenue = }} '''Yandex Maps''' is a Russian{{cite web|url=http://www.igismap.com/8-best-alternative-to-google-maps-classic-old-map/|title=8 Best Alternative to Google Maps - Classic old Map - GIS MAP INFO|date=30 May 2015|website=Igismap.com|accessdate=27 October 2017}} [[web mapping]] service developed by [[Yandex]]. The service provides detailed maps of the whole world. It includes a search, information about traffic jams, routing and [[Yandex Panoramas|street panoramas]]. The service was launched in 2004.{{cite web|url=http://www.gpsbusinessnews.com/GPS-phones-generate-traffic-information-in-Russia_a1206.html|title=GPS phones generate traffic information in Russia|first=Ludovic|last=Privat|website=Gpsbusinessnews.com|accessdate=27 October 2017}} Yandex Maps is the most popular cartographic service in [[Russia]]. It has about 11.5 million users in Russia per month, and over 20 million worldwide.{{cite web|url=https://comments.ua/world/225794-yandeks-zapustil-georeklamu.html|title="Яндекс" запустил георекламу|website=Comments.ru|accessdate=27 October 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://mediaplanerist.ru/maps.yandex/|title=Реклама на Яндекс.Карты.ru|website=Mediaplanerist.ru|accessdate=27 October 2017}}[https://semsocial.ru/polzovateli-yandeksa-mogut-redaktirovat-karti-08042015-1951] {{dead link|date=October 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://1prime.ru/Transport_communications/20111206/753277953.html|title=Панорамные снимки еще десяти городов России опубликованы на "Яндекс.Картах"|website=1prime.ru|accessdate=27 October 2017}} ==Features== The service initially had maps only of Russia and Ukraine, but now includes world maps. Maps are available in four versions: maps, [[Satellite imagery|satellite images]], satellite images with captions, and legend (hybrid). Users can measure distance and get directions by dragging between spots on a map.{{cite web|url=http://www.bettertechtips.com/internet/google-maps-alternatives/#7Yandex_Map|title=9 Map Apps Alternative to Google Maps|date=22 June 2017|website=Bettertechtips.com|accessdate=27 October 2017}} The search is available by both geographical objects (addresses, streets, cities, regions and countries) and by organizations. The illumination of the district, city or region is available after searching the organization on the site. Yandex Maps has a mobile application for [[Apple iOS|iOS]], Android and Windows phones. === Street view === [[File:Автомобиль компании Яндекс для съёмок фото-панорам улиц.jpg|thumb|Car, shooting panoramas for Yandex Maps]] On Yandex Maps it is possible to view street [[Yandex Panoramas|panoramas]]. There are street view even of [[Pripyat]] and [[Chernobyl]].{{cite web|url=https://www.popmech.ru/technologies/news-360352-yandeks-karty-obnovili-panormay-pripyati-i-chernobylya/|title=Яндекс.Карты обновили панорамы Припяти и Чернобыля|website=Popmech.ru|accessdate=27 October 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://maptd.com/new-chernobyl-panoramas-on-yandex-maps/|title=New, Chernobyl panoramas on Yandex Mapsmaptd|website=Maptd.com|accessdate=27 October 2017}} In 2016 a "street view" of [[Everest]] was photographed.{{cite web|url=http://7summitsclub.com/news/all/item_5593/|title=Unique panoramas of Everest appeared on Yandex Maps . They were made during an expedition 7 Summits Club!|website=7 Summits Club|accessdate=27 October 2017}} === Map editor === Users can make new data on the map with the help of the [[Yandex.Map editor]]. ==Yandex Traffic==
{|align=right style="text-align:center;" cellspacing=1 !colspan="4"|Scoring system of Yandex Traffic: |- |style="background-color:#00ff00"|1 — The roads are clear |- |style="background-color:#98ff98;"|2 — Roads are almost clear |- |style="background-color:#ccff00;"|3 — Places of difficulty |- |style="background-color:#FBF82D;"|4 — Places of difficulty |- |style="background-color:#F7E164;"|5 — Movement dense |- |style="background-color:#F4C023;"|6 — Traffic is difficult |- |style="background-color:#ff9966;"|7 — Serious traffic jams |- |style="background-color:#ff0000;"|8 — Multi-kilometer traffic jams |- |style="background-color:#ff4d00;"|9 — At a standstill |- |style="background-color:#f36223;"|10 — Walking is quicker |- |-style="font-size:80%;text-align:right;" |colspan="4"|[http://help.yandex.ru/maps/concept/stoppers.xml] |}
Yandex Traffic is a feature on Yandex Maps that displays traffic conditions in [[Real-time data|real time]] on major roads and highways. It can be viewed at the Yandex Maps website, or via the app. Yandex Traffic works by analyzing the GPS-determined locations transmitted to Yandex by a large number of mobile phone users. By calculating the speed of users along a length of road, Yandex is able to generate a live traffic map. It processes the incoming raw data about mobile phone device locations, and then excludes anomalies such as a postal vehicle that makes frequent stops. When a threshold of users in a particular area is noted, the overlay along roads and highways on the map changes color.{{cite web|url=https://books.google.pl/books?id=pOsODAAAQBAJ&pg=PA62&lpg=PA62&dq=Yandex+traffic&source=bl&ots=iwzReIzLyU&sig=xVHWubQAZaSPDPhbSypQwfghqDM&hl=pl&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwikyteN-5DXAhUjJJoKHRtDAFIQ6AEIajAJ#v=onepage&q=Yandex+traffic&f=false|title=Encyclopedia of E-Commerce Development, Implementation, and Management|first=Lee|last=In|date=31 March 2016|publisher=IGI Global|accessdate=27 October 2017|via=Google Books}}{{cite web|url=http://gorod.afisha.ru/people/kto-sostavlyaet-karty-yandeksprobok/|title=Афиша Город: Кто составляет карты "Яндекс.Пробок" – Архив|website=Gorod.afisha.ru|accessdate=27 October 2017}} == Criticism == * A satellite mode of Yandex Maps is not as detailed as Google Maps. * It has detailed maps only of Russia, Belarus, Ukraine, Turkey and Kazakhstan.{{cite web|url=http://www.downloadmaps.org/yandex-maps-review|title=Yandex Maps Review - DownloadMaps.org|first=|last=Rankyweb|date=7 April 2016|website=Downloadmaps.org|accessdate=27 October 2017}} * The editing functionality of Yandex Maps is currently available only in Russian language.{{cite web|url=http://www.gpsbusinessnews.com/Yandex-Revamps-Interface-Adds-Crowdsourcing-to-Maps_a5407.html|title=Yandex Revamps Interface, Adds Crowdsourcing to Maps|first=Ludovic|last=Privat|website=Gpsbusinessnews.com|accessdate=27 October 2017}} * Street view is available only for cities of Russia, Ukraine, Belarus, Kazakhstan, Armenia and Turkey. ==See also== * [[Comparison of web map services]] * [[Google Maps]] * [[OpenStreetMap]] * [[Here Map Creator]] * [[Wikimapia]] {{-}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [https://yandex.com/maps/ Yandex Maps] [[Category:Android (operating system) software]] [[Category:Internet properties established in 2004]] [[Category:IOS software]] [[Category:Mobile route-planning software]] [[Category:Pocket PC software]] [[Category:Route planning software]] [[Category:Web Map Services]] [[Category:Web mapping]]

{{morefootnotes|date=November 2018}} {{About|the Danish island|other uses}} {{Distinguish|Zeeland|New Zealand|Zealandia}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2018}} {{Infobox islands | name = Zealand | image_name = Stevns Klint.jpg | image_caption = The [[Stevns Klint|Cliffs of Stevns]] south of [[Copenhagen]] | image_size = | map_image = Denmark location sjalland.svg | native_name = Sjælland | native_name_lang = dk | nickname = | location = [[Baltic Sea]] | coordinates = {{coord|55|30|N|11|45|E|scale:2500000|display=inline,title}} | archipelago = | total_islands = | major_islands = | area_km2 = 7,031 | highest_mount = Kobanke | elevation_m = 122.9 | country = {{DEN}} | country_admin_divisions_title = [[Regions of Denmark|Region]] | country_admin_divisions = [[Capital Region of Denmark]], [[Region Zealand]] | country_admin_divisions_title_1 = | country_admin_divisions_1 = | country_admin_divisions_title_2 = | country_admin_divisions_2 = | country_capital_city = | country_largest_city = [[Copenhagen]] | country_largest_city_population = 1,181,239 | country_leader_title = | country_leader_name = | population = 2,302,074 | demonym = Zealander | density_km2 = 327.41 | ethnic_groups = | additional_info = }} '''Zealand''' ({{lang-da|Sjælland}}, {{IPA-da|ˈɕɛˌlanˀ|pron}}), at 7,031 km<sup>2</sup>, is the largest and most populous [[islands of Denmark|island]] in [[Denmark proper]] (thus excluding [[Greenland]] and [[Disko Island]], which are larger). Zealand has a population of 2,302,074 (as of 1 January 2018).<ref>[http://statistikbanken.dk/statbank5a/SelectVarVal/Define.asp?Maintable=BEF4&PLanguage=1 BEF4: Population 1 January by Islands], Statistics Denmark</ref>
It is the [[List of European islands by area|13th-largest island in Europe]] by area and the [[List of European islands by population|4th most populous]]. It is connected to [[Funen]] by the [[Great Belt Fixed Link]], to [[Lolland]], [[Falster]] (and Germany from 2028) by the [[Storstrøm Bridge]] and the [[Farø Bridges]]. Zealand is also linked to [[Amager]] by several bridges. Zealand is linked indirectly, through intervening islands by a series of bridges and tunnels, to southern [[Sweden]].
[[Copenhagen]], the capital of Denmark, is located partly on the eastern shore of Zealand and partly on the island of [[Amager]]. Other cities on Zealand include [[Roskilde]], [[Hillerød]], [[Næstved]] and [[Helsingør]].
Despite their identical names, the island is not connected historically to the Pacific nation of [[New Zealand]], which is named after the [[Netherlands|Dutch]] province of [[Zeeland]].
==Etymology== The exact origin of the Danish name "Sjælland" is controversial. ''Sjæl'' in Danish today means "soul", but based on older records one can exclude this interpretation. Even a derivation derived from ''siô / sæ'' (meaning "sea") corresponding closely to the English name is today largely rejected{{clarify span|text= – but it may be that the English name predated Danish research on its origin, compared with the current understanding; So the Danes themselves assumed that the name means "Zealand"|explain=As written, I'm afraid this is simply incoherent |date=September 2018}}. The prevailing view today is: The Old Danish form "Siâland" comes from a composition of the word *''selha-'' with the ending *''wundia-''. The latter means "indicates, resembles". The word *''selha-'' can have two different meanings: it can mean on the one hand "seal" (in modern Danish ''sæl'') and on the other hand mean "deep bay, fjord". Since the main settlement on Zealand was previously Roskilde, which is only accessible by sea through the narrow [[Roskilde Fjord]] (branched from the [[Ise Fjord]]), it is usually assumed that the sailors named the island after this.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://sprogmuseet.dk/ordhistorier/sj%C3%A6lland/|title=Sjælland …|last=Katlev|first=Jan|date=4 August 2009|website=www.sprogmuseet.dk|language=Danish|publisher=Danish Language Museum|accessdate=29 November 2017}}</ref>
==Mythological origins== [[File:Gefion.jpg|thumb|left|[[Gefion Fountain|Gefion]] carving Zealand from [[Sweden]].]] In [[Norse mythology]] as told in the ''[[Gylfaginning]]'', the island was created by the goddess [[Gefjon|Gefjun]] after she tricked [[Gylfi]], the king of Sweden. She removed a piece of land and transported it to Denmark, which became Zealand. The vacant area was filled with water and became [[Mälaren]].<ref>[[Den Store Danske Encyklopædi]], article ''Gefion''</ref> However, since modern maps show a similarity between Zealand and the Swedish lake [[Vänern]], it is sometimes identified as the hole left by Gefjun.
==Geography== Zealand is the most populous Danish island. It is irregularly shaped, and is north of the islands of [[Lolland]], [[Falster]], and [[Møn]]. The small island of Amager lies immediately east.
Copenhagen is mostly on Zealand but extends across northern Amager. A number of bridges and the [[Copenhagen Metro]] connect Zealand to Amager, which is connected to [[Scania]] in [[Sweden]] by the [[Øresund Bridge]] via the artificial island of [[Peberholm]]. Zealand is joined in the west to Funen, by the Great Belt Fixed Link, and Funen is connected by bridges to the country's mainland, [[Jutland]].
On June 5, 2007, the regional subsidiary of national broadcaster [[DR (broadcaster)|DR]] reported that [[Kobanke]] in the southeast near the town [[Rønnede]] in [[Faxe Municipality]], with a height of {{convert|122.9|m}}, was the highest natural point on Zealand. [[Gyldenløveshøj]], south of the city [[Roskilde]], has a height of {{convert|126|m}}, but that is due to a man-made hill from the [[17th century]] and its highest natural point is only {{convert|121.3|m}}.
Zealand gives its name to the [[Selandian]] era of the [[Paleocene]].
